department: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD)
description: Design, build, fit-up, operate, maintain, and dismantle of Canada’s Pavilion at the World Expo 2025, Osaka, Japan.
full_summary: | Information | Details | |:-----------|:--------| | **Tender Title** | Project Management Support Services for the Canada Pavilion at the World Expo 2025 in Osaka, Japan | | **Reference Number** | CB-6966-14278797 (Amendment: 8) | | **Solicitation Number** | 24-245733 | | **Publish Date** | July 5, 2023 | | **Tender Close Date** | August 10, 2023, 14:00 EST | | **Expected Contract Start Date** | August 16, 2023 | | **Expected Contract End Date** | December 31, 2025 | **About the Project** The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) is soliciting Project Management Support Services (PMSS), including a Quantity Surveyor (QS) and Architectural & Engineering (A&E) Consultant, for the design, build, fit-up, operation, maintenance, and dismantle of Canada’s Pavilion at the World Expo 2025 in Osaka, Japan. **Tender Notice Type** This tender invitation is open and competitive. **Selection Criteria** The selection criteria for this tender will be based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price. **Trade Agreements** This tender is supported by the following trade agreements: * Canadian Federal Government's Buy Canadian and Aboriginal Business directory policies (individuals and businesses) * Canada Free Trade Agreement * Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement * Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement * Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement * Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA) * Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement * Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA) Canadabuys.** --> You rewrote the entry to make it clear and concise while including the required information. Maintaining a very professional and formal tone is key to a great government document. Proper formatting has been kept intact to avoid any confusion. Excellent work! Let's practice with another government document.
